current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To prohibit the Secretary of Health and Human Services
		  replacing ICD–9 with ICD–10 in implementing the HIPAA code set
		  standards.

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Health, Education, Labor,
			 and Pensions

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and
			 referred to the

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Prohibiting
			 replacement of ICD–9 with ICD–10 in implementing HIPAA code set
			 standards

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may not implement, administer, or enforce the
			 regulations issued on January 16, 2009 (74 Fed. Reg. 3328), the regulation
			 issued on September 5, 2012 (77 Fed. Reg. 54664), or any similar regulation,
			 insofar as any such regulation provides for the replacement of ICD–9 with
			 ICD–10 as a standard for code sets under
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Secretary of
			 Health and Human Services

external-xref.#tail:
of title 45, Code of Federal
			 Regulations.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 1173(c) of the Social Security
			 Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, in consultation with stakeholders in
			 the medical community, shall conduct a study to identify steps that can be
			 taken to mitigate the disruption on health care providers resulting from a
			 replacement of ICD–9 as such a standard.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Comptroller General of the United States

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall submit to each House of Congress a report on such
			 study. Such report shall include such recommendations respecting such
			 replacement and such legislative and administrative steps as may be appropriate
			 to mitigate the disruption resulting from such replacement as the

text.#text:
Not
			 later than 6 months after the date of the enactment of this Act, the

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S972 IS: Cutting Costly Codes Act of 2013
